revised_title: Astronomical Observations and Lunar Parallax in Barbados
tldr: Nevil Maskelyne conducted astronomical observations at the Island of Barbados, Willoughby Fort, and the Observatory on Constitution Hill. He used various telescopes and instruments to study the satellites of Jupiter and the moon. Maskelyne aimed to determine the moon's horizontal and equatorial parallax, which had not been done before in such a direct manner.
